edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.zeroKnowledge

Class ZKPOKFromSigmaCmtPedersenProver

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.zeroKnowledge.ZKPOKFromSigmaCmtPedersenProver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ZKPOKProver, ZKProver

    public class ZKPOKFromSigmaCmtPedersenProver
extends java.lang.Object
implements ZKPOKProver
    Concrete implementation of Zero Knowledge prover.

    This is a transformation that takes any Sigma protocol and any perfectly hiding trapdoor (equivocal) commitment scheme and yields a zero-knowledge proof of knowledge.

    For more information see Protocol 6.5.4, page 165 of Hazay-Lindell.

    The pseudo code of this protocol can be found in Protocol 2.2 of pseudo codes document at http://cryptobiu.github.io/scapi/SDK_Pseudocode.pdf.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

    • Method Detail

      • prove

        public void prove(ZKProverInput input)
           throws java.io.IOException,
                  CheatAttemptException,
                  java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Runs the prover side of the Zero Knowledge proof.

        Let (a,e,z) denote the prover1, verifier challenge and prover2 messages of the sigma protocol.

        This function computes the following calculations:

        RUN the receiver in TRAP_COMMIT.commit; let trap be the output

        COMPUTE the first message a in sigma, using (x,w) as input

        SEND a to V

        RUN the receiver in TRAP_COMMIT.decommit

        IF TRAP_COMMIT.decommit returns some e

        COMPUTE the response z to (a,e) according to sigma

        SEND z and trap to V

        OUTPUT nothing

        ELSE (IF COMMIT.decommit returns INVALID)

        OUTPUT ERROR (CHEAT_ATTEMPT_BY_V)

        Specified by:
        prove in interface ZKProver
        Parameters:
        input - must be an instance of SigmaProverInput.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given input is not an instance of SigmaProverInput
        java.io.IOException - if failed to send the message.
        CheatAttemptException - if the challenge's length is not as expected.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if there was a problem with the serialization mechanism.

      • processSecondMsg

        public void processSecondMsg(byte[] e,
                    CmtRCommitPhaseOutput trap)
                      throws CheatAttemptException,
                             java.io.IOException
        Processes the second message of the Zero Knowledge protocol.

        "COMPUTE the response z to (a,e) according to sigma

        SEND z to V

        OUTPUT nothing".

        This is a blocking function!

        Throws:
        CheatAttemptException - if the challenge's length is not as expected.
        java.io.IOException - if failed to send the message.
